briefdescription.para: Returned by an xbee_cmd_callback_fn() if the handle can be released.
Returned by an xbee_cmd_callback_fn() if more reponses are expected, or it has re-used the command handle.
Queue changes until ATAC command or another request with XBEE_REMOTE_AT_OPT_IMMEDIATE set.
Apply changes immediately, don't wait for ATAC command.
Mask to ignore extra bits used in the status response.
The RSSI field of the ATND response is not valid [DigiMesh].
Possible values of status byte in xbee_header_local_at_resp_t and xbee_frame_local_at_resp_t.
Status codes for xbee_cmd_list_status()

detaileddescription.para: We force these to be -Exxx codes (or 0).

briefdescription.para: No default action. Often used for callbacks.
Copy response data byte-for-byte to base struct, starting at offset 0 and setting remaining bytes to 0x00.
Copy response data byte-for-byte to base struct,.

detaileddescription.para: padding with 0x00 bytes before the copied data, to have last copied byte in last position of base struct. (see ATSH/ATSL).

briefdescription.para: Copy response, changing expected big-endian to host byte order, and store in base struct.

detaileddescription.para: Data must be 1, 2 or 4 bytes, assumed unsigned.

briefdescription.para: Use data in base struct as parameter for command, with binary data copied byte-for-byte.
Use data in base struct as parameter for command, with null-terminated string data copied byte-for-byte.
Use data in base struct as parameter for command, changing host byte order to big-endian.

detaileddescription.para: Data must be 1,2 or 4 bytes, assumed unsigned.

briefdescription.para: Set value to immediate 8-bit constant in .bytes field of the xbee_atcmd_reg_t entry.

detaileddescription.para: No response.

briefdescription.para: Last command, any response is discarded, no further command list entries are processed.

detaileddescription.para: This is useful if ND is the last command, since the command list will terminate, but discovered nodes will be handled subsequently (asynchronously).

briefdescription.para: iDigi RCI type names used by do_command type=zigbee.

detaileddescription.para: This table is used so as to avoid having XBEE_RCI_TYPE_STRING pointers in the register descriptor table.

briefdescription.para: Callback registered to an AT Command with xbee_cmd_set_callback().

detaileddescription.para: It should not modify the contents of the xbee_cmd_response_t structure passed to it. It should return either XBEE_ATCMD_DONE or XBEE_ATCMD_REUSE.
View the help on xbee_cmd_response_t for details on the members of that structure.

parameterdescription.para: response received for AT Command
done with the request handle
more responses are expected, or the request handle will be reused

simplesect.para: xbee_cmd_set_callback(), xbee_cmd_response_t

briefdescription.para: Header for AT Commands sent to the local (serially-attached) XBee.
Header to AT Commands sent to a remote XBee on the network.
Response to an AT Command sent to the local serially-connected XBee.
Response to an AT Command sent to a remote XBee.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* xbee_command_list_fn) (const xbee_cmd_response_t FAR *response, const struct xbee_atcmd_reg_t FAR *reg, void FAR *base)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const xbee_cmd_response_t FAR *response, const struct xbee_atcmd_reg_t FAR *reg, void FAR *base)
memberdef.name: xbee_command_list_fn

briefdescription.para: Callback registered for individual command list commands.

parameterdescription.para: response received for AT Command. From this, the context field points to the start of the entire set of commands in the list being processed.
Table element for this command. Usually, the callback will dereference reg->context to find any required auxiliary data for processing this command.
Base address of structure to populate with response value (typical use).

simplesect.para: This callback is called for a command response, and is intended to be used for manipulating the raw response data into something suitable for the application. There is no corresponding callback for a request (i.e. called before setting parameter data); the application is expected to perform setting parameter manipulation before invoking xbee_cmd_list_execute().

briefdescription.para: Table used to keep track of outstanding requests.

memberdef.name: _xbee_atcmd_query_regs
memberdef.initializer:
= { XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'H', 'V', XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE, xbee_dev_t, hardware_version), XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'V', 'R', XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE, xbee_dev_t, firmware_version), XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'S', 'H', XBEE_CLT_COPY_PAD_LEFT, xbee_dev_t, wpan_dev.address.ieee.l[0]), XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'S', 'L', XBEE_CLT_COPY_PAD_LEFT, xbee_dev_t, wpan_dev.address.ieee.l[1]),
XBEE_ATCMD_REG_CB( 'E', 'O', _xbee_cmd_query_handle_eo, 0), XBEE_ATCMD_REG_CB( 'A', 'I', _xbee_cmd_query_handle_ai, 0),
XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'N', 'P', XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE, xbee_dev_t, wpan_dev.payload), XBEE_ATCMD_REG( 'M', 'Y', XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE, xbee_dev_t, wpan_dev.address.network),
}

internal.para: List of XBee registers to query at startup; used to learn about the attached XBee module.

internal.para: Convert a handle (16-bit int) to a pointer into the command request table. Ensures that the handle is valid (correct index and sequence bytes).

parameterdescription.para: Handle returned from xbee_cmd_create().

simplesect.para: Pointer into the request table or NULL if handle is invalid.

internal.para: Helper function to send off the next command in the list.
Callback used by xbee_cmd_query_device (and possibly other functions) to learn about the attached XBee device (hardware/firmware version, address, etc.)
View function help for xbee_cmd_set_callback() for details on xbee_cmd_response_t structure. This callback should only be called by xbee_cmd_handle_response(). ***

briefdescription.para: Execute a list of AT commands.

parameterdescription.para: Device to execute commands
List head to set up. This must be static since callback functions access it asynchronously.
First entry of list of commands to execute. The list must be terminated by either XBEE_ATCMD_REG_END or XBEE_ATCMD_REG_END_CB. List entries are created using XBEE_ATCMD_REG macros etc.
Base address of a structure to fill in with command results or as a source of values to set.
Remote address, or NULL if local device.
started sending commands from the list
the AT command table is full (increase the compile-time macro XBEE_CMD_REQUEST_TABLESIZE)
an invalid parameter was passed to the function

briefdescription.para: Determine status of command list execution.

parameterdescription.para: List head passed to xbee_cmd_list_execute().
currently executing commands
successfully completed
timed out
completed with error(s)

briefdescription.para: Initialize the AT Command layer for an XBee device.

detaileddescription.para: You need to call this function before any of the other xbee_cmd_* functions.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device on which to enable the AT Command layer. This function will automatically call xbee_cmd_query_device if it hasn't already been called for this device.
the XBee device was successfully configured to send and receive AT commands
an invalid parameter was passed to the function

Callback function to receive the AT Command response. This function should take a single parameter (pointer to an xbee_cmd_response_t) and return either XBEE_ATCMD_DONE (if done with the request handle) or XBEE_ATCMD_REUSE (if more responses are expected, or the request handle is going to be reused). intatcmd_callback(constxbee_cmd_response_tFAR*response)
Context (or "userdata") value to pass to the callback along with the AT Command response when it arrives. Should be set to NULL if not used.
callback set
handle is not valid

memberdef.name: xbee_cmd_set_target

briefdescription.para: Associate a remote XBee device with a given AT Command request.

detaileddescription.para: By default, xbee_cmd_create() configures the request as a local AT Command for the serially-attached XBee module. Use this function to send the command to a remote device.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the request, as returned by xbee_cmd_create().

Pointer to 64-bit IEEE hardware address of target, or NULL to switch back to the local XBee device.
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_BROADCAST for broadcast.
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_COORDINATOR for the coordinator (use WPAN_NET_ADDR_UNDEFINED for the network address).
WPAN_IEEE_ADDR_UNDEFINED to use the 16-bit network address.

16-bit network address of target.
WPAN_NET_ADDR_UNDEFINED if the node's network address isn't known or this is a DigiMesh network.
WPAN_NET_ADDR_COORDINATOR for the coordinator (use the coordinator's actual IEEE address for the ieee parameter).
WPAN_NET_ADDR_BCAST_NOT_ASLEEP to broadcast to all nodes that aren't sleeping.
WPAN_NET_ADDR_BCAST_ROUTERS to broadcast to the coordinator and all routers.
target set
handle is not valid
function not implemented (XBEE_CMD_DISABLE_REMOTE defined)

briefdescription.para: Offset into _xbee_atcmd_query_regs to use when refreshing the xbee_dev_t/ wpan_dev_t structure.
Maximum number of outstanding requests.

detaileddescription.para: Two should be sufficient in most (all?) cases. One might even be enough if space is tight.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of bytes in the parameter sent to a command.

detaileddescription.para: The NI command takes a 20-byte string. ATZT is 48 bytes, ATZU is 22. Platforms can override this when limiting to AT commands with shorter parameters (e.g., 16 bytes when not using the certificate parameters).

briefdescription.para: Timeout (in seconds) to wait for a response to a remote command.

detaileddescription.para: Set to a high value to allow for a sleeping end device.

briefdescription.para: Timeout (in seconds) to wait for a response to a local command.
Macro for checking the status byte of an AT response.

detaileddescription.para: If this library is compiled without DigiMesh support, we can use a simpler test.

memberdef.name: XBEE_ATCMD_REG

briefdescription.para: Macro used in creating command list tables.

detaileddescription.para: This macro does not set a callback.

parameterdescription.para: first character of AT command
second character of AT command

one of xbee_command_list_type enumerated values: XBEE_CLT_NONE - no action except to issue the command. 'obj' and 'field' parameters are ignored. XBEE_CLT_COPY - copy response data directly, followed by 0x00 to fill the target element XBEE_CLT_COPY_PAD_LEFT - copy response data directly, padding to the left with 0x00 to fill target element XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE - copy numeric data to host byte order XBEE_CLT_SET - set command parameter directly XBEE_CLT_SET_STR - set command parameter as null- terminated string. XBEE_CLT_SET_BE - set numeric command parameter
typedef name of object at base address
field in obj in which to store result

simplesect.para: The 'type' parameter allows for either setting the data in the base structure as the command parameter (XBEE_CLT_SET*) or the converse, which is copying the command result back to the base structure (XBEE_CLT_COPY*).
xbee_atcmd_reg_t record for constructing command list tables

8-bit flags for callback (arbitrary).

parameterdescription.para: first character of AT command
second character of AT command

one of xbee_command_list_type enumerated values: XBEE_CLT_NONE - no action except to issue the command. 'obj' and 'field' parameters are ignored. XBEE_CLT_COPY - copy response data directly, followed by 0x00 to fill the target element XBEE_CLT_COPY_PAD_LEFT - copy response data directly, padding to the left with 0x00 to fill target element XBEE_CLT_COPY_BE - copy numeric data to host byte order XBEE_CLT_SET - set command parameter directly XBEE_CLT_SET_STR - set command parameter as null- terminated string. XBEE_CLT_SET_BE - set numeric command parameter
typedef name of object at base address
field in obj in which to store result
callback function (prototype xbee_command_list_fn)
8-bit flags for callback (arbitrary).

second character of AT command

simplesect.para: xbee_atcmd_reg_t record for constructing command list tables

briefdescription.para: Macro used in creating command list tables.

detaileddescription.para: Used to terminate table, with no special final callback. This must be the last entry if used, or XBEE_ATCMD_REG_END_CB must be used.

briefdescription.para: Macro used in creating command list tables.

detaileddescription.para: Used to terminate table, with a command (usually ND or WR). This must be the last entry if used.

briefdescription.para: Macro used in creating command list tables.

detaileddescription.para: Used to terminate table, with a final callback. This must be the last entry if used, or XBEE_ATCMD_REG_END must be used.

parameterdescription.para: callback function (prototype xbee_command_list_fn).

simplesect.para: The 'response' parameter to the callback will be the final command response received.

parameterdescription.para: 8-bit flags for callback (arbitrary).

briefdescription.para: Is entry index available (unused)?
Return the handle for entry index (combination of index and .sequence member of entry).
This layer wraps the AT request/response frames to provide an easy method for querying/setting registers on, and sending AT commands to the XBee.
